wikipedia_page.main: John Moore (1821, Woodbridge – 12 April 1902, Diss) was a prominent Ipswich artist, particularly notes for his seascapes. Originally a painter and decorator, he became a self-taught artist. He moved to Ipswich before 1871, and was a founding member of the Ipswich Fine Art Club in 1874. He found many patrons amongst the wealthy inhabitants of the town.

response: *John Moore of Ipswich, (1821–1902), painter and decorator
